verses.text: Now when I was come home again, and my wife Anna was restored unto me, with my son Tobias, in the feast of Pentecost, which is the holy \add feast\add* of the seven weeks, there was a good dinner \add prepared\add* me, in the which I sat down to eat.
And when I saw abundance of meat, I said to my son, Go and bring what poor \add man\add* soever thou shalt find \add out\add* of our brethren, who is mindful of the Lord; and lo, I tarry for thee.
But he came \add again\add*, and said, Father, one of our nation is strangled, and is cast out in the marketplace.
Then before I had tasted \add of any meat\add*, I start up, and took him up into a room until the going down of the sun.
Then I returned, and washed myself, and ate my meat in heaviness,
remembering \add that\add* prophecy of Amos, as he said, Your feasts shall be turned into mourning, and all your mirth into lamentation.
Therefore I wept: and after the going down of the sun I went and made a grave, and buried him.
But my neighbours mocked \add me\add*, and said, This \add man\add* is not yet afraid to be put to death for this matter: who fled away; and \add yet\add* lo, he burieth the dead again.
The same night also I returned from the burial, and slept by the wall of \add my\add* courtyard, being polluted, and my face was uncovered:

and I knew not that there were sparrows in the wall, and mine eyes being open, the sparrows muted warm \add dung\add* into mine eyes, and a whiteness came in mine eyes; and I went to the physicians, but they helped me not: moreover Achiacharus did nourish me, until I went into Elymais.
And my wife Anna did take womenâ€™s works to do.
And when she had sent \add them\add* home to the owners, they paid her wages, and gave her also besides a kid.

And when it was in mine house, and began to cry, I said unto her, From whence \add is this\add* kid? is it not stolen? render it to the owners; for it is not lawful to eat \add any thing that is\add* stolen.

But she replied \add upon me\add*, It was given \add for\add* a gift more than the wages. Howbeit I did not believe her, but bade \add her\add* render it to the owners: and I was abashed at her. But she replied upon me, Where are thine alms and thy righteous deeds? behold, thou and all \add thy works are\add* known.
